Reviews.Title: Decent budget point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Emitstop
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Small- Rechargeable battery- Decent settings and features- Takes good footage (say if the band that you're managing needs a music video done)- Menus and buttons are intuitive, and easy to navigate.Cons:- It doesn't look like the battery charges when its plugged in via usb, which is kind of disappointing. (You need to take the battery out and stick it into an included charger).- Pictures/Videos are quite grainy/weird when viewed at full resolution, If you shrink it down to perhaps 25% it's not very noticeable.- You'll need to buy an SD card if you want to take more than a few pictures at a time (built-in storage is only 14.5MB!)- Opening/closing the little cover for the USB jack is beyond annoying. Hurts my fingers to open it and then again to try and jam it back in.Other thoughts:It's a decent, budget point-and-shoot. It's ideal for facebook photos, family/outing pictures, that sort of thing. It's not that much better than some higher-end cell phone cameras. Amateur photographers look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Two thumbs up!
Reviews.Author: KDN80 "Kim"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of months now, and while I was hesitant to buy it (never having been a Casio fan before), I am so glad I took the chance on it.  For the price I have been duly impressed!  Shutter speed is great, which was a huge sticking point for me on so many digital cameras in the past.  Even when your subject is in motion, it generally captures a shot without fuzziness.  The colors come out true and in good quality.  Features are about the same as any other digital camera, no surprises that I've found in that department.  Zoom works nicely and even on full zoom I haven't had a problem with pictures coming out fuzzy...I've had a hard time in the past keeping the camera still enough.  All things considered, for the price, this is a really great little camera!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for...
Reviews.Author: ZombieHooker
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera almost a year ago, to capture the birth of my daughter.  The very day I was in the hospital, I went to turn it on and the lens became stuck.  Fortunately I had other people there to take her newborn photos, but I had to wiggle and tap on the lens while turning it on and off to get it unstuck, and function properly.  Since I've owned this camera, it's done this on more than one occasion.I'm quite disappointed in the graininess of the large full-sized images.  I have owned a 6 megapixel Samsung point and shoot that was cheaper and older and even that camera took much clearer, noise-free photos than this piece of garbage.  I do not believe the video is truly 720p.  The videos are also grainy, and do not look sharp, like HD videos should.The battery door is flimsy, and for some reason is now bending outward.

Reviews.Title: I'm not a professional photographer but I know what I like
Reviews.Author: ALEXANDER S WON
Reviews.Content: I've had mine since 2011. I use it to take pictures when I'm visiting new places or hanging out with friends/family. I could use my smart phone but it's too expensive.The price is right, the size is right and it's easy to use. The pictures and videos are fine. For anyone who wants something fun for a good price this is the best choice.

Reviews.Title: A waste of money
Reviews.Author: Shar Ann
Reviews.Content: The (Lens) zoom was junk, It did not want  to work , It got stuck a lot. A waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Great picture for the price
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a couple of years now for quick shots.  Only drawback is the battery must be removed and charged on clunky charger (included).

Reviews.Title: Hiding from reviews
Reviews.Author: CGell
Reviews.Content: It seems there are no reviews for a good reason, they don't want you to see them. Here is a professional review from a digital camera review site..."The Casio Z800 feels flimsy and cheap because it is flimsy and cheap. The skinny body is constructed with thin plastic; clearly, Casio cut corners on this area - and it shows. After a few days of normal use, the Z800 broke.""It's safe to call the Z800 a disaster. We reviewed this camera, despite two of them breaking" (editors comment)- [...]

Reviews.Title: casio
Reviews.Author: Irene Gray
Reviews.Content: Recommend by a friend. It worked real at 1st then pooped out. I was disappointed. It did take good pics but the flash NEVER workedended up getting a different brand

Reviews.Title: Cheap and good.
Reviews.Author: Edir Garcia
Reviews.Content: It's amazing to get a camera this good for this price. Seriously if you want something just to take casual photos and video, this is a great choice. It makes a weird buzzing noise when focusing on one of the modes, though. This camera takes pictures as good as others priced 150-200 usd. It's worth it.

Reviews.Title: review of Casio
Reviews.Author: Philip B. Sallberg
Reviews.Content: I consider this camera to be a very good buy for the cost. Excellent pictures easy to operate. Very satisfied

Reviews.Title: little but powerful camera
Reviews.Author: Fran
Reviews.Content: Received this camera just in time for vacation. Already owned a previous model that is only 6 megapixels. The difference was unbelievable. Easy to carry easy to use! love it. not disappointed in the least!Takes great video as well.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: La Rose
Reviews.Content: The camera is great...very easy to use and it takes great picturesCasio Exilim EX-Z800 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)

Reviews.Title: Nice quality picture...
Reviews.Author: Dj Deivid
Reviews.Content: Love this cam... But there are some problem with it... It's probably that I used it all thay long but the battery did not last too long.. I bought it specifically for the Electric Zoo (The most amazing rave party in New York) to use it from 11 am to 11 pm and the battery died around 9 pm. I did not take that many pics but I used it to record videos, Nice quality but poor audio input... Sounds like fart!!! Just use it for pics if you are going to buy this... I had to use my cel phone and I like the video and sound quality of my phone better (Motorola Cliq2).

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Drew Shivley
Reviews.Content: This camera takes decent photos, not spectacular, but not bad for a camera in this class.  I use mine at work for snapping photos in the field and have dropped it a few times and besides a few scratches, it's fine.  Battery door is definitely flimsy and that could be a downfall.  Also, the flash is placed right where I naturally put my finger in the front causing my finger to shadow the flash sometimes so that usually causes me to have to re-shoot.  Lastly and most obnoxious is that the battery seems to only charge via the wall charger and will not charge via USB.

Reviews.Title: Stay Away from this Disaster!
Reviews.Author: Ganapathy Subramaniam
Reviews.Content: I was attracted by the nice compact size, and the simple interface, with an ample LCD screen, the ability to shoot videos, and the tempting resolution number.A few test shots kind of made me think this is a Ok camera 'for the price', and went ahead and bought it.It does have a no nonsense design. Everything worked simply.I took it home, spent time clicking and shooting. In bright light, inside the room, with flash, HD, regular etc. and as I saw the outcome on the LCD, I kept reminding to myself, well.. 'you get what you pay for'. and its a nice package.Then I plug this in to the computer, and after transferring the files, I just sat there horrified. Its just disastrous. Very poor resolution. grainy, blurry, noisy images. My 5MP mobile phone shoots better. I madly searched my archives, pulled out a old images I shot using the early digital cameras of about 1 MP, and they look sharp!! Believe me!.Also slowly I became aware of the flimsy SD card cover, the awkward USB plug.. and it dawned on me.. this camera is going straight back where it came from. And yes.. it did.A camera is something we use to create images that we want to store for long time. There is no reason for *Any* camera manufacturer to manufacture a camera that cannot produce decent quality images.Its simply not acceptable to say, "you get what you paid for".Even if I were given this camera for free, I still think its a disaster. I will be ruining all my memories with those blurry, noisy, unclear images for posterity. (In fact I bought this as a gift for someone, and decided its not worth even if the person gets it for free)I would rather store those beautiful memories in my head (however dull they might become) than in this contraption, Casio is bold enough to call a camera.After a bit of searching I just figured that they are painting some cartoon characters on the body now and selling it to kids. Cheeky.

ProductInfo.Features:
14.1mp Image Quality
4x Optical Zoom
High Density 2.7" LCD Screen
720p HD Video
CCD Image Stabilization
ProductInfo.Name: Casio Exilim EX-Z800 14.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Black)
